author: mandrigin
content: I just figured out that witnesses might be useful to solve this kind of issue: https://twitter.com/DeanEigenmann/status/1278027312907325443

author: mandrigin
content:
basically, we can replace the transactions that don't touch contracts with transaction witnesses.
Like, if we are watching a contract C.
The block might look like:
```
transactions: [
     <tx_witness_0>,
     <tx_witness_1>,
     actual_transaction_that_touches_C,
     <tx_witness_3>,
     ...
]
```
In that case we don't need to execute the transactions we aren't interested in, but we still can validate that the root hash matches.

author: mandrigin
content: tx witnesses here should have an important property though, they should produce the state __after__ transaction execution, and not before. Which isn't really a bit deal, but will make terminology even more messy ðŸ™‚
